title: How have England changed their game in order to team up Tom Curry and Sam Underhill?
text:
Both Tom Curry and Sam Underhill shone as Australia, featuring David Pocock and Michael Hooper, were dumped out of the Rugby World Cup last weekend.

Four years ago, those two excellent Wallabies ransacked Twickenham. With that in mind, the influence of England’s young flankers in Oita felt emblematic of their team’s development. Eddie Jones is guiding a 2019 campaign that has looked more energetic and assured.

One pillar of it, the Curry-Underhill partnership, has come on rapidly – and before our very eyes – over the course of three compelling months. Three aspects have been integral to its progress.

Discipline and decision-making

Curry and Underhill were first named in the same back row for...
